Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, fourteen lines of an administrative text, a journal of arrears of water supply on specific days. Each entry consists of a date, followed by 'by the duty-person' with a name, then 'remainder (still owing) of water' with a measurement in khars, often 1.25 (nearly a100 litres) which was probably a day's ration for a workman and his household.
Curator's comments: For the subject, see J.J. Janssen,'The Water Supply of a Desert Village', 'Bulletin of the Medelhavsmuseet' 14 (1979), pp. 9-15. Bibliography: S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum' (London, 1868), pl. XIX (lower); J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 23 and pl. LXXXVII, 1; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' VII (Oxford, 1989), p. 239.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136355) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136355)
